snips.snip:
TICK_LENGTH = 15

whilePressed = ($parse, $interval) ->
  restrict: "A"

  link: (scope, elem, attrs) ->
    action = $parse(attrs.whilePressed)
    intervalPromise = null

    bindWhilePressed = ->
      elem.on('mousedown', beginAction)

    bindEndAction = ->
      elem.on('mouseup', endAction)
      elem.on('mouseleave', endAction)

    unbindEndAction = ->
      elem.off('mouseup', endAction)
      elem.off('mouseleave', endAction)

    beginAction = (e) ->
      e.preventDefault()
      tickAction()
      intervalPromise = $interval(tickAction, TICK_LENGTH)
      bindEndAction()

    endAction = ->
      $interval.cancel(intervalPromise)
      unbindEndAction()

    tickAction = ->
      action(scope)

    bindWhilePressed()

forever stop 0

Experienced Web/Desktop Software Developer and Consultant

Hello,

I have over 20 years of experience as a software developer/consultant. I specialize in full stack data intensive line of business
and web applications. By full stack I mean the front end (UI) and the back end (database and web server).

My current development stack is Javascript, React or React-Native, HTML5, CSS3 and Node JS.
I have worked with data (design and query) from SQLite, MySql, SQL Server, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Excel, EXIF (from picture files)
, JSON and restful sources.
My DevOps experience includes deploying Nginx, MongoDB and MySql on Ubuntu running multiple instances of Node JS.

I am very good at understanding business requirements and identifying ways to maximize technology benefits.


You can view my resume and examples at http://jmarkstevens.com.

Steps to add identical subflows which allow independent editing.

1. create and save flow to become subflow
2. export flow to become subflow
3. open flow to receive subflows
4. import exported flow to become subflow. leave default import to current flow
5. create subflow
6. copy imported flow into subflow. add in and out
7. add subflow to flow in tab 1
repeat 5,6 and 7
delete imported tab, close subflow tabs, save flow
to edit subflows double click select edit subflow
